item.description:
This is Module #3, which follows from #1 and #2 already held. This series will repeat starting in June.

Interested in learning about permaculture design but not sure if you can invest in a full-blown design course?

Then the Permaculture Design Seminar Series might be a good fit for you. In a small group setting (no more than 10-12 people) and at an affordable price, work with local permaculture designer and organizer Lisa Fernandes on a real design project close to Portland. We will meet for 3-hour sessions and you can enroll in one or more modules. It is expected that the whole series will be about 3-4 modules long (depending on the property) stretching over several weeks. Design and some implementation strategies will be covered. The series will repeat with a different project if there is enough interest.

The series is suited to those who are new to permaculture or are ready to apply some of their permaculture knowledge to a "live" project.

Module #3: Pattern Literacy, Water Strategies and Hands-on Project
In this module we will build on our work so far with our South Portland "client" as well as gain some additional insight into a primary inspiration for permaculture design: patterns in nature. Since we are helping to create an edible perennial ecosystem (aka "a garden") then we will also examine a variety of ways to incorporate and work with water on this property. We will either have hands-on experience with installing one aspect of the draft design we're creating OR we will turn our attention to Zone 0 (the house), depending on clients' readiness to proceed, etc.

Module #4: May 28 "Bring it All Home" by developing an implementation plan for/with the clients and by understanding the elements of a comprehensive permaculture design report. Hands-on project very likely.

We will meet from 5:30 to 8:30 with a short 15 min break part-way through. We can either bring potluck food to share or chip in on something to share. Beverages provided. Bring your potluck kit either way.

Payment Note: I have turned on the Amazon payments tool that the meetup site offers because it is the only way to require payment as a condition of making a 'yes' RSVP. This isn't my preferred method BUT in order to keep admin costs down and avoid having to manage checks/deposits/chasing non-payments & no-shows....well, you know. If you are REALLY serious about attending this but cannot use plastic, please email me and we can make arrangements.
